WorkItem.Description:
From thread:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=56737
Â 
I'm having a problem with closing my generated excel2007 file. PHPExcel creates and saves my excel2007 file correctly. When I open the excelsheet I don't get errors and everything looks fine. But when I close the sheet (without making changes) I always get the message 'Do you want to save the changes you made to myfile.xlsx?' When I click yes and open and close the file again, the message doesn't show anymore. But when I click no, the message apears everytime I want to close the excel file. Did I do something wrong? Thanks in advance.
WorkItem.Summary: "Save changes on close" problem in Excel when there are formulas

Comments.Message:
This is also happening with Excel5 writer, but here you get a slightly different message, so the problem might be different there:

"Do you want to save the changes...
"Microsoft Office Excel recalculates formulas when opening files last saved by an earlier version of Excel."

There are various calculation modes that can be set for the document:
http://support.microsoft.com/kb/214395

Perhaps we need to investigate whether something needs adjustment.

For PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5 we are one step closer after this:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=10030

Now both PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007 and PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5 exhibit exactly the same problem as described.

What could be the problem? More research needed!

In Excel2007, this is due to the fact that we are creating 100% compliant OpenXML files, but not 100% compliant Excel files.
For example, a calculation chain should be included according to Excel, but not according to OpenXML specs (optional). Since we are creating compliant OpenXML, this is more of an Excel issue (or behaviour) than a PHPExcel issue.
